citations.narrative:
In the budgie aviary’s shelter building, a yellow budgie was located outside its primary enclosure. The budgie was found
free flying between the exterior door of the building and the primary enclosure within an access area for the caretakers.
The budgie had escaped its primary enclosure and had no access to food, water, or perching in this area. Also, being
located in this hallway gave the bird direct access to an exterior door that could lead to further escape outdoors. Birds that
escape their primary enclosure could become injured, malnourished, or be lost outdoors. Primary enclosures must be
constructed and maintained so that they contain the birds securely.
The bird was returned to its primary enclosure at the time of inspection.
Correct by: November 30, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the budgie aviary’s shelter building, a yellow budgie was located outside its primary enclosure. The budgie was found 
free flying between the exterior door of the building and the primary enclosure within an access area for the caretakers. 
The budgie had escaped its primary enclosure and had no access to food, water, or perching in this area. Also, being 
located in this hallway gave the bird direct access to an exterior door that could lead to further escape outdoors. Birds that 
escape their primary enclosure could become injured, malnourished, or be lost outdoors. Primary enclosures must be 
constructed and maintained so that they contain the birds securely. 
The bird was returned to its primary enclosure at the time of inspection. 
Correct by: November 30, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
